Reviews.Title: “dump”
Reviews.Author: margaret h
Reviews.Content: this has got to be the most overpriced hotel i have ever stayed in i have just got back from a 1 night stay and believe me that was too long the room was very small and dingey the bathroom was ridiculously small and im only 5ft 2 anybody taller would have no chance the so called dining room was a joke the tables were fold up camping tables. The best is they were charging £169.00 a night luckily my sister booked it through hotel beds.com and we only paid half the price i definitely would not recommend this hotel even if u are on a budget . the only plus side was the location for victoria appllo theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad as everybody say”
Reviews.Author: Hrvoje1
Reviews.Content: I was there in March 2011, in 5 bed room with my frineds. We payed 20€ each/per night and for that price I am very satisfied. The room was clean, the bathrom was clean (also very small because all of my frineds, including me, were playing basketball and each of us is 2m tall). We used room just for sleeping and breakfast ( which is a little bit parsimonius). The room service was good because every time we came back to room it was all clean and fixed. All I can say is that for the price that we payed it's a very good place to stay (at least our room was) especially if you're using a room like we did, just for sleep, eat something in the morning and leave the things you bought.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't stay there”
Reviews.Author: etto
Reviews.Content: booked this room through British Hotel Reservation Centre (BHRC) located at St Pancreas station when I traveled from Paris to London last month, October 2011. I prepaid for 2 nights at the Romanos Hotel at 31 Charlwood street, Victoria, London. I took the metro to Victoria station and walked to the small hotel. Immediately, upon entering their lobby, I knew I probably couldn't stay just from the condition of the lobby. I ask the clerk behind the desk if I could view the room first. He stated that it didn't matter if I liked the room or not, I was still paying. He acted put out that I would want to see the room first but reluctantly did take me to the room because I insisted. the hotel was very run down, smelled horribly and was not somewhere I could stay. I left the hotel. I am currently attempting to get the charges reversed through my credit card company since I didn't stay the two nights. That day, I e-mailed BHRC because I wanted them to know how unhappy I was that they would place me in such a bad hotel. I never heard back from them. I ended up re-emailing them 2 more times, each time requesting a response but never received any. It's apparent to me that BHRC is less concerned about providing adequate lodging than obtaining the booking fee kick back that they receive from the London establishments that they represent. Don't use BHRC for your bookings and stay away from the Romanos Hotel unless you normally like to stay in run down, smelly, unkempt surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “By far the worst place I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: mary h
Reviews.Content: I was staying overnight en route to France and had intended to return for one evening on my way home five days later. However, the whole experience was so unpleasant that I never returned. Firstly, the staff were incredibly rude and didn't seem to be at all accommodating to the requests made at the time of booking, despite assuring me that they would be able to provide me with an en suite and breakfast before my early departure. The ensuite bathroom was outside my room and up a flight of stairs! I was told on arrival that no-one would be around to provide breakfast at 6.30am "for just one person" The lady who welcomed me to the hotel could not have made me feel any less valued as a client. My room was filthy - I have stayed in developing and war-torn countries where facilities are basic, however they have always been far cleaner than my room. The bedding alone was unpleasant, without mentioning the other hygiene concerns! Having spent a reasonable £15 on a taxi from Euston to the hotel, which is a short distance from Victoria, I was very surprised when I was quoted £19 for a taxi organised by reception to take me and my luggage to Westminster Cathedral to pick up the next stage of my journey. Thankfully I knew where I was going, as reception had booked the taxi to take me to Westminster Abbey! It seems to be the sort of place where people rent rooms by the hour - hardly what you would like to stay amongst as a stop over! I have never felt less secure in a hotel as a solo traveller anywhere - Africa, Latin America, Eastern Europe. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone it is truly awful with no redeeming features.

Reviews.Title: “This is what I sent to them. Official complaint.”
Reviews.Author: marcdoudin
Reviews.Content: Hello Romanos, I was staying in your "hotel" the last 7 nights. I wanted to place a complaint via e-mail. It was incredible. I booked your hotel by Gatwick Station and paid 70 pounds for one night. 70 pounds is the price for a good hotel. Coming to your hotel, your personnel received me with a friendly "Room 8, Floor 2", without any comment or any advices. Well, I can live with that. But coming into the room, I felt like: how come I can't even turn around in my bathroom? Well maybe that's a matter of design, but in my home bathroom I can't brush my teeth, being on toilette and taking a shower at the same time, because it's not that small. Coming to your breakfast in the morning means having no space for legs, arms or anything. The "Continental Breakfast" consisted of six toasts (who would ever dare to ask for more for two people being served by such a "nice" personnel) and one egg. Well, at least a cup of tea then. Next experience was the room service. Brilliant. After three days, pillow and blanket were incredibly dirty. How did you "clean" that? Speaking about cleaning: Have you ever washed your towels? I rather felt like drying myself with my clothes. Other things: the walls looked like a fancy pattern by a modern artists (dirty, musty, HEALTH!!!!!!), the lamp of my bedside was broken and the room service didn't ever clean anything. The worst thing of your hotel, dear Romanos, is not the filthyness and the dirty rooms and unreliable personnel. No, it's the missing friendlyness, the missing passion of all of your staff. I did not feel welcome, I did not feel good, I just felt bad in your hotel. After four nights, the room service knocked at my door at half past eight in the morning and told me to get out of the hotel. I needed to leave the hotel because I haven't paid yet. "Aha. They got it after four nights, fine.", I thought. Once again: Me and my friend, we paid 70 POUNDS FOR THAT ROOM PER NIGHT, 6 NIGHTS. Cheers. Oh btw, you remember that I've booked via Victoria Station? Yes, so I paid before and I couldn't leave the hotel, if that could be an argument of yours. We unfortunately needed to add one night more because we stayed one night longer in London and were too late for booking another hotel. Your only comment was "Have you paid? You need to pay, or you leave". Well.. we wanted to pay via credit card, but that was not possible without an extra charge of 5 POUNDS FOR PAYING BY CARD. We went to a cash machine and got back to you. You said like "Give me the Key" to log that thing in. Another thing, and the actual claiming of this e-mail is the incredible amount we needed to pay for our room. 70 pounds is, considering your own pricelist on the internet, 11 pounds too much per day. Your double rooms cost 59 pounds, which is your own tag. (Source: www.romanos-hotel.co.uk) I claim 77 pounds payback. 7 nights, 11 pounds each. If you don't pay back those 77 pounds, I feel obliged to send the whole, and I mean, the whole complaint to each forum I can find that has any relation to hotels or London. Also, I'm sending this as a copy to the official LONDON HOTEL CONTROLLERS. I placed that complaint already in a oral way. But you didn't care about it, so I decided to give it another try via e-mail. I'm waiting for your answer, to leave my bank details. I love London, but you, you're a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: artmac21
Reviews.Content: Booked this last minute double room for Â£75. Was dreading the hotel given reviews however, really surprised. Room was small with ensuite shower. But clean and all we needed for the night. The location is fantastic and very central excellent for Victoria train and coach station. Breakfast was ideal, toast and bolied eggs just enough to get you started for the day. Staff don't speak much english but very diligent. A good base for a short trip. I would use again. Better value than the previous 3* hotel we stayed in night before. To be honest I would have used this for the two nights if previuos reviews hadnt been so off putting. Small, clean, not too noisy, good value for London.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive,stay away!Only as a last choice accomodation”
Reviews.Author: AquaSof
Reviews.Content: In june 2010 my brother and I had made a booking at a nearby hostel which was really unorganised and there was no room available despite the booking,so we found Romanos hotel instead where we stayed for 3 days.It was really expensive because of the last minute reservation (as we were told) and we were given a tiny room in the basement with a sink and a bed. The sheets and blankets seemed dirty and a bit rugged plus there was no bathroom in the basement and we had to go up in the second floor to find a decent bathroom.No problem there,it was clean and I never found it occupied despite the hotel being full.However the kitchen was next to the room and the noise was terrible every morning,didn't sleep quietly!Though the breakfast was full and with plenty of choices and even served after the programmed hours. The service wasn't that bad,they were trying to be helpful but didn't speak english that well and were rather lazy as we had problems with the entrance card several times and they postponed helping us.The location is good,it's between two metro stations,one of them being victoria and it's in a small street which decreases a bit the amount of noise. I would recommend only as a last alternative of hostels mainly to yound people and low-budget travellers,as long as the booking in done ahead!

Reviews.Title: “excellant value for money”
Reviews.Author: CATH24601
Reviews.Content: A large clean room with a double and 3 single beds for Â£79.Have stayed here several times previously. Quite basic but generally clean. In an ideal position right next to a bus stop heading for Trafalgar Square and therefore very handy for the West End. The main draw back is that the staff speak virtually no English. It took several minutes to persuade them to let us leave our case as they appear to have withdrawn the luggage storage facility. However when we told them we were frequant customers,they were more than happy to lock it in the dining room!

Reviews.Title: “The worst 'hotel' I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Lydmae
Reviews.Content: Possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Apparently their motto is: "Stay comfortable ... Pay reasonable." I laughed when I read that on my door! Upon arrival at this hotel I was rather disappointed. After a three hour journey to get to London I arrived eager to drop off my heavy bag + freshen up ready to see the sights. However I was told that my room was not ready; I would have to wait until 4pm to check-in. Though this was rather inconvenient I agreed to come back later, but was suspicious at the way the staff wanted me to pay now + leave straight away. By the time i walked back out the door the manager shouted "See you at six o'clock then - make sure you dont come back before six!" which made me quite suspicious that the time had again changed. Returning four hours later at six o'clock i was told the room was still not ready + again asked to pay before entering which i refused until i had seen the room. Eventually the manager guided me in + i was quite horrified at the state of the room after all the waiting. It was extremely cramped with just enough room to walk around the bed (which had rather dodgy looking sheets; i am doubtful they had been cleaned since the last guest). The 'ensuite' bathroom was simply a broom cupboard with a contraption that looked like a shower with a toilet built in the bowl! I was surprised also that after all that time cleaning there was a collection of hairs in the shower and at the back of the toilet! After reading on the website that the hotel had recently been refurbished and described as "modern and tastefully designed, offering a warm relaxing atmosphere and a high degree of comfort" I felt extremely let down and frustrated. By now it was 7 o'clock + having looked at many hotels coming towards Romano's with NO VACANCIES signs in the windows, I had no choice but to accept the room + sleep there for the night. I was sure i had seen the worst of the place anyway... That was until at around 10.30 at night a cleaning lady strolled into my room, grabbed a pillow off my bed + walked out again, not saying 2 words to me! I was appalled! After a sleepless night laying on top of the sheets, not daring to climb in (it was incredibly stuffy in there anyway) i went down to breakfast which was served by the same lady, who again said nothing to me. The layout was awful as the tables were not properly set. Some had cups, others did not, some had condiments and others did not. Choosing the table with the cups i sat down only to find the cups + plates were dirty. i was given two boiled eggs which were cold and when i cracked the shell, was digusted to find the yolk was black!? This was the case for both of them! I quickly chewed a bit of cold dry toast (i was not given butter) and sharply left ... passing a family in the reception being told that there room was not yet ready! I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. There are hundreds of hotels in this area and i only wish i had left earlier to find something better.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: leabarker
Reviews.Content: stayed here for the weekend , very basic room to the point you no draws or wardrobe. The kettle cord didnt reach the plug socket. And the bathroom was like a caravan ! Having said that it was clean and well placed. We paid 65 pound a night . To be fair thats very cheap for the area and allowed us much more spending money to enjoy our break. So all in all i would have to say its value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly awful.”
Reviews.Author: 05bettwi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was told to be all lovely and rosey, reality it isnt to be fair I wouldnt allow my animals in here. The rooms were unstable and easy excessable to the public, and theifs could easly be tempted by vaubles on show. The bathroom looked like a cloak cupboard, and you couldnt even turn round without banging into another wall. The breakfast was one cold over cooked boiled egg with just a piece of toast, not very good to be starting the day. Staff were not understanding towards our needs and also not sympathetic towards our circumstances, and werent vert trusting in the visitors. The image outside is very diseaving and the website even more so, the Â£90 we spent for a one night stay was unable to be justified.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't stop laughing!!”
Reviews.Author: housebudd
Reviews.Content: A triple room not big enough to swing a cat in. Paper thin walls throughout. A toilet/shower that looked like, and was as big as, a caravan toilet compartment! When sitting on the toilet your knees touched the closed door! Shower curtain hanging off. No wardrobe just hangers on a rail under the portable TV shelf. Breakfast on fold-up camping tables and chairs in the tiniest of rooms. Food cold. Location was great though for anywhere round Victoria way.

Reviews.Title: “ordinary but adequate”
Reviews.Author: Flea_and_Ad
Reviews.Content: The family room was very ordinary,but you get what you pay for and for London it was quite reasonable.We were happy to have somewhere to sleep after travelling for 24 hours.The room was warm and generally clean.The bathroom was so small you couldn't swing a cat in it,but it did the job.The position of the Hotel is its main attraction.It was in a fantastic area full of great restaurants and pubs.It was close to Victoria station and you could walk to Westminser Abbey,and Buckingham Place and most the main tourist attractions.We were out all day and just went back there to sleep.Our expectations were pretty low after reading the reviews,but for the start of our European holiday as a family of 4 with kids aged 9 and 11,the price was right.We made a joke of it like it being like Fawlty Towers with the unfriendly receptionist and the tiny breakfast room.We would probably stay there again as a family of 4,But if it were just two of us I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap accommodation in great location but...”
Reviews.Author: ozdeco
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Basic accommodation, not very clean, noisy room - especially when it seemed that the owner's quarters were directly above our room and there was lots of family noise until quite late. One morning the fire alarm (situated in our room) went off. No-one came to investigate and we were left to find someone in charge to find out if we needed to evacuate. The alarm went off a second time before we could find anyone and then it was dismissed as "toast burning set the alarm off". Well, thanks for telling us and the other guests. We booked the hotel at Victoria Station - we were quoted half the stated rack rate displayed in the office and just as well as the owners need to do a complete makeover, clean, paint, new bed linen and curtains. We were told we would have to pay extra to leave our luggage for a few hours on our last day. It's a shame that it is so grotty, because the hotel is in a great position and it has great potential.

Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel owned by people that could barely speak English”
Reviews.Author: holidayloverz
Reviews.Content: when me and a friend first arrived here we immedietly noticed that our room was number one, we were in the basement and it soon became clear that we were 'shoved' out of the way in the worst room i have ever seen, the rooms are all suppose to have T.V's - apparently the woman said they were only in the ensuite rooms, half the door was stuck to one corner and only a small half of the room would open, when i entered the room there were old plug socket marks and such like that had been plastered poorly over, i presume it was from re-wiring the room, the room stunk of human faeces from the toilet nearby, with no ventalation the rooms stench could not be sorted, we asked the woman if we could upgrade to an ensuite where the rooms were far better at a price of Â£50 extra a night. The new room had a tiny door in the corner where behind you could go to the toilet, have a shower and shave all at the same time, the windows here were also extremely dangerous as the height of the start of the window was around my knee height so if i fell against the wall i would have fallen straight out of the window off the 5th floor of the hotel. All in all i deffinetaly would not reccomend this hotel even though it is almost centrally located to the attractions of London city. I think it is important to mention that im only from Manchester, UK and if i was coming from over seas i would find a different hotel imperatively.

Reviews.Title: “Dont read the negative reviews..look here first”
Reviews.Author: Bepositivesmile
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband and two children have just returned from staying at this Hotel for five nights. We were greeteed with helpful, informative, very pleasant staff, who were only too willing to accomodate our needs and requests. Our room was the quadruple room,wth ensuite facilities which suited us as a family very well. Yes, the shower room was small but we all managed to shower, wash without restriction. The room was cleaned daily and clean towels given. The cleanliness of the room was of a high standard. The Romanos is very centrally located with many good restaurants,bars and cafes in the surrounding area. However we walked daily to westminster which took us about 15-20 minutes, from there it is easy to travel around London. I would not hesitate to stay here again and would recommend staying here to others who may be thinking of a holiday in London.

Reviews.Title: “staw from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: robbiemanu
Reviews.Content: stay away from this dump if you possibly can.shower is lovely if your a five year old child cause adults won't fit in.cant describe how bad it is.

Reviews.Title: “Way below basic!”
Reviews.Author: bondieliz
Reviews.Content: I wouldnt call this place a hotel, more like a dodgy B & B. The staff-one woman who was so unfriendly that I felt like I was intruding! Was very disappointed with the room. The bathroom was so small the toilet was basically on top of the shower! No blinds or mirror in the room. The decor was something out of the 50s! Can get a nicer room for the same price, recommend to shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Fair value for money”
Reviews.Author: Emma_Vienna
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights in Romanos. I was on a business trip, very busy all the day and with social events every evening. So I only spent the nights in Romanos and I have to admit that it offers fair value for money. The room and the bathroom were small but still acceptable, the hotel was clean and the environment quit and safe. The breakfast is always the same and not the best and very modest. It is located in a nice building in Belgravia, the bus stop is just round the corner, Victoria station is about 10 minutes walk. It is good choice for business trips.

Reviews.Title: “It gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: RixiePicklesticks
Reviews.Content: We booked this place for 60GBP through one of those "50% off hotels!" stands at Victoria station. 60 GBP was a rip off for this place, but it was a place to stay at least. It is close to a number of different popular tourist sights, so I'll give it that. It is thin walled so if it's noisy that could be problematic. Luckily it wasn't noisy for our stay. It was definitely small and not nicely kept-up. But I don't think it was too dirty. I would only really recommend this place if 1: you can get it for less than 45GBP a night or 2: you're in desperate need of a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic , Staff RUDE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissMonty
Reviews.Content: Basic but okish for money! Our room slept 4 of us which was ok but you could have a shower while sat on the toilet while brushing your teeth over the sink, yes it was that small! Breakfast was horrible all we got was a warmish boiled egg and some toast even the tea tasted nasty. The young guy that worked there looked scared, he didnt say a word, but then the woman that worked there was VERY RUDE from the moment we got there to the moment we left, she had no manners at all. I won be staying there again!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Petitpoussin
Reviews.Content: Very small room Tiny & unclean bathroom Horrible breakfast Staff unfriendly

Reviews.Title: “Go there never”
Reviews.Author: abvictry
Reviews.Content: I went to stay in this hotel hoping that B & B s would be comparitively cheaper. It cost me 60 pounds per night and four days of absolute trauma. The rooms are shabby, bed r not immune from bugs and the reception staff are excellant at slagging you off. My towels were changed only on request but then I got used to it after the second day. The breakfast is probably the only service to expect there which was okay(at least something). But I advice think twice before halting at the reception. The people are extremely rude as if we are still not civilized. All in all a paid nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “A place to lay your head”
Reviews.Author: NLoriel
Reviews.Content: We were setting for a week-long trip to explore London and needed a basic place to stay, so we decided to risk (seeing the mood of the previous reviews) staying at Romanos. The hotel's location is its main advantage - it really lies within walking distance of many of the city's tourist attractions, particularly the Buckingham Palace, Tate Britain, London Eye and Imperial War Museum. We even made a trip to the Tower Bridge and back, visiting Tate Modern and other stuff on the way. It's also a few minutes' walk from the Victoria rail and coach station (direct buses to/from Luton, Gatwick, Stansted), and Pimlico tube. The hotel was very clean in general - only the bed covers look a bit worn up. Most of the rooms are accessible only through a steep and narrow stairway - you just have to consider it if you're going to book there. Accomodation is no frills - toilet in the room is the size of a wardrobe - tiny sink, toilet and shower all packed into a box about 1 per 2 meters. The sink is old British style - meaning two taps, cold and hot water separately. The problem was that it missed a plug - in fact, all sinks in the hotel missed them. The lady at the check-in desk promised to provide us with this useful device, but at the end we wouldn't get it - even though we stayed there for more than a week! There isn't much of space in the room to place your belongings - a set of coat hangers, a shelf and a "desk" (that's what they call it in the promo materials) which is, in fact, another shelf. So we kept most of our stuff in the suitcase. The electric kettle was OK, so was the TV, and there was a hairdryer available at the reception desk. The breakfasts were really OK - "continental", as they call it, which means a set of tosts, cereal, an egg, tea or coffee and assorted jams. A good way of starting a day, and really useful since you don't have to start your trips hungry and looking for food. The dining room is of course very small, like everything at Romanos, so it was good that not many of the guests got up early enough to bother themselves with the breakfast (which was served from 7-something to 9 on weekdays, 8 to 9 or ten on weekends). There is also a small courtyard you may use for breakfast if the weather is good enough - which it wasn't. Okay, to sum it all up. If you plan on touring the city all day long, and just need a place to sleep and wash yourself up, then Hotel Romanos is OK. If you'd like to spend some more time in the hotel room or requre more than basic accomodations - you'd better search for another place. However, you possibly won't find it at this price - Holiday Inn Express on Belgrave costs about twice as much as the Romanos.

Reviews.Title: “basic of basic!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ratrog
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 2 nights.upon arrival we had to pay CASH upfront,which we have never had to do(makes you think the owner doesn`t trust his guests). Room was extremely basic and had recently been painted,but not just the walls: pictures,bedspread,carpet,tv and the mirror!!!!.If you are over 6foot 3 you may have trouble getting into the bathroom/toilet (looks like a cupboard!!)not what we call a ensuite On the plus side excellent location for visitors with 2 tube stations within 5 minutes of each other(wouold recommend Victoria-more of a major line). Back to the hotel : staff could be more considerate to their guests - we were woken at 5 am on our last day by them having a big arguement - can`t tell you about what because it was in foriegnese!!.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: SirGoofy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for two nights at this hotel. The location is reasonable, not at the city center but the price is reasonable for a quad room. The breakfast is mediocre and the TV does not work. Overall we just need a place to sleep and shower. It was quite hot in the summer and there is no fan. The cleanliness of the room could be better. Note that there is additional charges if you pay by card. Cash is the preferred option and you have to pay upfront when you check in unlike any other hotels I have been.

Reviews.Title: “Room small but clean, Staff Awful”
Reviews.Author: K_Wilson7
Reviews.Content: My mother arrived at the Romanos first with the booking details. She had been delayed on her flight and was very tired. She walked in to reception and the receptionist told her she was not allowed in the room until she had paid the total outstanding amount (even though a deposit had been paid). My mother asked if she could pay by debit card and was told that she would be charged a Â£10 handling fee. She said she would get cash and pay later but the receptionist would not let her in the room until she had paid so she had to go out and find the nearest cash-point (about 20 minutes walk away) before she was allowed in the room. The room was small but clean. Booking en-suite is not worth it. It literally is a cupboard with toilet, shower and sink in. We ended up using the communal shower as it was bigger and had more space. The breakfast room is a small room crammed with camping tables and chairs. Breakfast was okay: toast, two types of cereal and a hard-boiled egg, but again the staff were awful and made you feel like a burden for being there. If you want a cheap room for the night, take cash to pay for the room upfront. If you are looking for a bit of hospitality, don't bother staying at this hotel - they do not know what the word means!

Reviews.Title: “a horrible place”
Reviews.Author: penzance
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for one night after spending some days in cornwall and it was really horrible. Our room was very small and without most of the in room facilities they add in their web page. We didn't have electronic keycard, any tv, Ironing Facilities. All the rooms are suposed to have writing desk and seating area but ours didn't have any space even for a chair. We didn't see any alarm clock. What we had was the walls full of stains, and the blanket that was suposed to be white was grey and dirty. All the rooms had card keys access except our so we guessed that our room woud had been a storage room a box room or a junk room before being a bedroom. If you stay in Romanos avoid room 2. And the FRIENDLY woman at the reception (i'm ironic) wanted to charge us 5 pounds to leave our luggage so we told her we'd rather leave it in the station lock up. I'll never stay in this hotel again

HotelInfo.Name: Romanos Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 31 Charlwood Street | Victoria, London SW1V 2DU, England
